lines.value: the russian empire also called imperial russia was a country which was located in europe as well as asia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it started in 1721 when peter i of russia proclaimed it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: before that it was known as the duchy of moscow
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it lasted until it was declared a republic in march 1917 after the russian revolution
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was an absolute monarchy ruled by russian emperors known as tsars
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they were members of the house of romanov and believed that they had the divine right of kings over their people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1914 the russian empire covered an area of about 21799825 kmÂ²
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1897 it had a population of 128200000 1897 year
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: its official language was the russian language
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: its official church was the russian orthodox church
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the russian empire was led by a tsar who had complete control of the nation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in this absolute monarchy only tsar could create and revoke laws
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1905 the tsar granted a new constitution in which he shared some power with a partly elected duma parliament
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the russian empire was a great power and one of the biggest empires that ever existed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most people in imperial russia were peasants
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they lived mainly in rural areas until the late 19th century when the emancipation of the serfs freed them from the farms where they had to stay
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they were allowed to marry whomever they wanted own property and vote
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a few people were nobility also called boyars
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they were educated and held higher prestige
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: towards the end of the 19th century many of the educated wanted to remove the tsar and give people more power
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1917 world war i caused the bad conditions of people who worked in factories to become even worse with a food shortage
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people blamed it on the tsar and rebelled
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: cities such as st petersburg and moscow were faced with riots
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the tsar was soon forced to abdicate in the february revolution in 1917
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after the october revolution he was assassinated with his family
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1922 most of the russian empire became the union of soviet socialist republics or ussr when a communist government won the russian civil war
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some of the counties in the empire escaped but the biggest ones were forced into the ussr
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an acute myocardial infarction also called a heart attack happens when a blood vessel in the heart suddenly becomes blocked
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: blood vessels carry blood and oxygen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when a blood vessel in the heart gets blocked blood cannot get to part of the heart
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this part of the heart does not get enough oxygen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is called ischemia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when the heart muscle becomes ischemic does not get enough blood and oxygen the ischemia often causes chest pain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is called angina pectoris
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if the ischemia lasts long enough the heart muscle that is not getting enough oxygen dies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is called an infarction
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: myocardial infarction means infarction muscle death in the heart muscle a heart attack is a medical emergency
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first few minutes are very important for keeping the person alive
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some of the damage from the heart attack can be repaired if the person gets treatment during the first hour of the attack
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most heart attacks are caused by coronary artery disease cad
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in coronary artery disease a wax like material called plaque builds up on the inside walls of arteries in the heart
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is called atherosclerosis
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: plaque is made of cholesterol and other cells
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the amount of plaque increases slowly
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as more plaque builds up the insides of the heart's blood vessels get narrower
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this means that less blood can flow through the blood vessels
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this can cause platelets which make the blood clot to build up in front of the plaque
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this causes a blood clot in the blood vessel
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if the clot breaks free and gets stuck in part of the blood vessel made narrower by the plaque the plaque and the clot together block the blood vessel completely
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this makes it impossible for blood to get to part of the heart and causes a heart attack
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a person can lower their chances of getting coronary artery disease by eating healthy foods exercising not smoking cigarettes and not drinking too much alcohol
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: signs that a person is having a heart attack show over several minutes and ly come immediately
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most people having a heart attack have chest pain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sometimes people also have pain in the left arm the lower jaw the neck the right arm the back or in parts of the abdomen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many women have different symptoms than men
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the most common symptoms include shortness of breath trouble breathing weakness and feeling very tired
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some women feel tired do not sleep properly and have shortness of breath for up to a month before they have a heart attack
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: women may also have nausea and stomach upset when having a heart attack
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sometimes people have silent heart attacks these are heart attacks that do not cause any pain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are more common in elderly people women and people with diabetes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in these people suddenly feeling very tired or fainting may be the only sign of a heart attack
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a heart attack is a medical emergency that needs treatment as quickly as possible
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the most important thing is to save as much myocardium heart muscle as possible and prevent more complications
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as time passes the risk of damage to the heart muscle increases
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: doctors or paramedics usually start certain treatments as soon as a heart attack is suspected
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these treatments include
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: clot busting medicines called thrombolytics can dissolve blood clots that are blocking the blood vessels in the heart
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this makes it possible for blood and oxygen to flow again to the part of the heart that was not getting enough blood and oxygen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the most common clot busting medicine is called tissue plasminogen activator tpa
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: clot busters work best if patients get them within 30 minutes after getting to the hospital
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however if a patient gets a clot busting medicine within 12 hours after the heart attack starts they have a better chance of surviving
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: clot busting medicines do have some risks
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sometimes they can thin the blood too much and cause bleeding
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: percutaneous coronary intervention is a way of opening blocked coronary arteries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: percutaneous means that the procedure is not done by cutting a person open in surgery
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: coronary intervention means way to help the heart
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: percutaneous coronary intervention is also called coronary angioplasty
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in a percutaneous coronary intervention a doctor threads a flexible tube into one of the patient's blood vessels usually one in the upper thigh
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the doctor threads the tube up to the blocked blood vessels in the heart
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on the end of the tube is a balloon
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the doctor blows up the balloon which pushes the plaque and blood clot against the side of the blocked blood vessel
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this allows blood to flow through that blood vessel again
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sometimes a doctor might also place a small mesh tube called a stent into the blood vessel
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the stent will make sure the blood vessel stays open and does not get blocked again in the future
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as soon as a person thinks they may be having signs of a heart attack they should call emergency service right away
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: emergency services can be reached dialling 911 in the us and 112 in most of continental europe however the average person waits about three hours before asking for help
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when a person waits to get help they are more likely to have more serious damage to their heart
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the american heart association says time is muscle the more time a person waits to get treatment the more heart muscle dies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if a person is having trouble breathing sitting straight up can help
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the person should follow any instructions they get from the emergency operator or their doctor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a genetic disorder is an illness caused by abnormalities in the genome

lines.value: some only show up in later life

lines.value: genetic disorders like other illnesses can cripple and kill
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most genetic disorders are quite rare and affect one person in every several thousands or millions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sometimes they are relatively frequent in a population
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these types of recessive gene disorders give an advantage in certain environments when only one copy of the gene is present
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sickle cell anaemia is an example
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the same disease such as some forms of cancer may be caused by an inherited genetic condition in some people by new mutations in other people and by nongenetic causes in still other people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a disease in only called a genetic disease when it is inherited

lines.value: space time is a mathematical model that joins space and time into a single idea called a continuum
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this four dimensional continuum is known as minkowski space
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: combining these two ideas helped cosmology to understand how the universe works on the big level e.g galaxies and small level e.g atoms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in non relativistic classical mechanics the use of euclidean space instead of space time is good because time is treated as universal with a constant rate of passage which is independent of the state of motion of an observer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but in a relativistic universe time cannot be separated from the three dimensions of space
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is because the observed rate at which time passes depends on an object's velocity relative to the observer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: also the strength of any gravitational field slows the passage of time for an object as seen by an observer outside the field
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: wherever matter exists it bends the geometry of spacetime
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this results in a curved shape of space time which can be understood as gravity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the white lines on the picture on the right represent the effect of mass on space time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in classical mechanics the use of spacetime is optional as time is independent of motion in the three dimensions of euclidean space
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when a body is moving at speeds close to the speed of light relativistic speeds time cannot be separated from the three dimensions of space
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: time from the point of view of a stationary observer depends on how close to the speed of light the object is moving
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many people link space time with albert einstein who proposed special relativity in 1905
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however it was einstein's teacher hermann minkowski who suggested space time in a 1908 essay
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his concept of minkowski space is the earliest treatment of space and time as two aspects of a unified whole which is the essence of special relativity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he hoped this new idea would clarify the theory of special relativity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: minkowski spacetime is only accurate at describing constant velocity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was einstein though who discovered the curvature of space time gravity in general relativity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in general relativity einstein generalized minkowski space time to include the effects of acceleration
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: einstein discovered that the curvature in his 4-dimensional space time representation was actually the cause of gravity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the 1926 thirteenth edition of the encyclopedia britannica included an article by einstein titled space time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: edgar allan poe wrote an essay on cosmology titled eureka 1848 which said that space and duration are one
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is the first known instance of suggesting space and time to be different perceptions of one thing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: poe arrived at this conclusion after approximately 90 pages of reasoning but employed no mathematics
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1895 hg wells in his novel the time machine wrote there is no difference between time and any of the three dimensions of space except that our consciousness moves along it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he added scientific people...know very well that time is only a kind of space
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in general relativity spacetime is thought of as smooth and continuous
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however in the theory of quantum mechanics spacetime is not always continuous
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the corpus cavernosum penis or corpus cavernosum urethrae is one of two sponge like sections of tissue in the male penis

lines.value: they contain most of the blood during an erection
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the term literally means cave like body
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the corpus cavernosum are placed along the length of the penis
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are found along the penis shaft from the pubic bones to the head of the penis
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the spongy tissue fills with blood
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the blood comes from arteries down the length of the penis
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the blood fills the corpora cavernosa
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this causes it to swell
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when swollen it holds 90% of the blood involved in an erection
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this increases both the length and circumference of the penis
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: blood can leave only through a system of veins around the outside wall of the corpus cavernosum
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the expanding tissue constricts these veins
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this preventing blood from leaving
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the penis becomes rigid as a result

lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his marriage to isabella of castile unified most of the iberian peninsula as spain and started its move to become a great power
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ferdinand was the son of john ii of aragon by his second wife the aragonese noblewoman juana enriquez
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he married infanta isabella the sister by a different mother of henry iv of castile on 19 october 1469 in ocana
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he became ferdinand v of castile when isabella succeeded her brother as queen of castile in 1474
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the two young monarchs had to begin with a civil war against juana princess of castile also known as juana la beltraneja who claimed to be the daughter of henry iv
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they won
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ferdinand succeeded his father as king of aragon in 1479
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this meant the crown of castile and the various territories of the crown of aragon were united in a personal union
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for the first time since the 8th century this created a single political unit which might be called spain although the various territories were not properly administered as a single unit until the 18th century
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first decades of ferdinand and isabella's joint rule were taken up with the conquest of the kingdom of granada the last muslim enclave in the iberian peninsula
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was completed by 1492 and then the jews were expelled from both castile and aragon
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the royal couple sent christopher columbus on on his expedition which discover the new world
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by the treaty of tordesillas of 1494 the extra european world was split between the crowns of portugal and castile by a north south line through the atlantic ocean
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ferdinand was busy in the last decades of his life with the so called italian wars

lines.value: he was fighting with the kings of france for control of italy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1494 charles viii of france invaded italy and expelled ferdinand's cousin alfonso ii from the throne of naples

lines.value: ferdinand's alliance with various italian princes and with emperor maximilian i expelled the french by 1496 and installed alfonso's son ferdinand on the neapolitan throne
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1501 following the death of ferdinand ii of naples and his succession by his uncle frederick ferdinand of aragon signed an agreement with charles viii's successor louis xii
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: louis had just successfully asserted his claims to the duchy of milan and they agreed to partition naples between them with campania and the abruzzi including naples itself going to the french and ferdinand taking apulia and calabria
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the agreement soon fell apart and over the next several years ferdinand's great general gonzalo fernandez de cordoba conquered naples from the french by 1504
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: another less famous conquest took place in 1502 when andreas paleologus de jure emperor of the eastern roman empire left ferdinand and isabella as heirs to the empire thus ferdinand became de jure roman emperor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after isabella's death her kingdom went to her daughter joanna
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ferdinand served as the latter's regent during her absence in the netherlands ruled by her husband archduke philip
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ferdinand attempted to retain the regency permanently but was rebuffed by the castilian nobility and replaced with joanna's husband who became philip i of castile
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after philip's death in 1506 with joanna mentally unstable and her and philip's son charles of ghent only six years old ferdinand resumed the regency ruling through francisco cardinal jimenez de cisneros the chancellor of the kingdom
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1508 war resumed in italy this time against venice
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all the other powers on the peninsula including louis xii ferdinand maximilian and pope julius ii joined together against as the league of cambrai
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: although the french were victorious against venice at the battle of agnadello the league soon fell apart as both the pope and ferdinand became suspicious of french intentions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: instead the holy league was formed in which all the powers now joined together against france
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in november 1511 ferdinand and his son in law henry viii of england signed the treaty of westminster pledging mutual aid between the two against france
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: earlier that year ferdinand had conquered the southern half of the kingdom of navarre which was ruled by a french nobleman and annexed it to spain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at this point to reinforce his claim to the kingdom ferdinand remarried with the much younger germaine of foix 1490-1538 a granddaughter of queen leonor of navarre
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the holy league was generally successful in italy as well driving the french from milan which was restored to its sforza dukes by the peace treaty in 1513
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the french were successful in reconquering milan two years later however
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ferdinand died in 1516 in madrigalejo caceres extremadura
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he had made spain the most powerful country in europe
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the succession of his grandson charles who inherited not only the spanish lands of his maternal grandparents but the habsburg and burgundian lands of his paternal family would make his heirs the most powerful rulers on the continent
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: charles succeeded him in the aragonese lands and was also granted the castilian crown jointly with his insane mother bringing about at long last the unification of the spanish thrones under one head
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ferdinand and isabella had 5 children isabella of asturias juan of aragon joanna of castile maria of aragon and catherine of aragon
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: joanna and catherine married with several european dynasties setting the bases for the huge heritage of their grandson charles v his granddaughter was queen mary i of england
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: * history of spain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: kidney failure also called renal failure is a term used to describe when a person's kidneys stop working properly or fail
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: kidney failure can be divided into two categories chronic renal failure and acute renal failure
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: chronic renal failure develops slowly and there are not many noticeable symptoms at first
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: chronic renal failure can be a sign of other diseases like iga nephritis glomerulonephritis chronic pyelonephritis and urinary retention
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: chronic renal failure will eventually develop into end stage renal failure if it is left untreated
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: end stage renal failure can only be treated with dialysis or a kidney transplant
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: acute renal failure develops in a short time and symptoms are more noticeable
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: symptoms include
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is possible to have acute renal failure on top of chronic renal failure
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is called acute on chronic renal failure
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ayrton senna da silva march 21 1960 - may 1 1994 better known as ayrton senna was a brazilian formula 1 driver who won the championship three times in 1988 1990 and in 1991
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he died in an accident that took place on the autodromo enzo e dino ferrari better known as imola in the 1994 san marino grand prix
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he is considered by many people to be the most skilled driver in the history of motor racing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: senna was born in sao paulo a city in brazil
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when he was four years old he first got into a kart
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when he was 13 he entered a karting competition for the first time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a fun fact is that he started his first kart race on pole position
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the start places were written on pieces of paper and put in a driver's helmet and he drew number one
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because he was a lot lighter than the other racers he was much faster than all of them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he won the south american kart championships in 1977 and was runner up in the world championship but he never won it.in 1981 he raced in the british formula ford 1600 championship and won it as well
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he also changed his name to senna since da silva is used a lot in brazil
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1982 senna won two european championships the european and the british formula ford 2000
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after testing with williams mclaren brabham and toleman he got a place within the toleman team for the 1984 formula one season
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the toleman team was a very small team compared to other famous teams like williams mclaren and brabham
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: even though the team built a car good enough to let senna impress with his talents
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ayrton senna scored his first championship point on april 7 1984 at the south african grand prix
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: three races later senna impressed at the monaco grand prix where it was raining
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: senna started on the 13th position but right after the race started he soon was gaining position after position on the track that is known for its small roads
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on the 19th lap he took second place from niki lauda and was making up a lot of time to the race leader alain prost
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it started to rain harder and the race was stopped on the 31st lap
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: even though almost everyone agrees senna should have won the race senna had a result to be proud of
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the rest of the season he would finish third place in two races the britisch and the portuguese grand prix
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he finished his first year in formula one racing on a shared 9th position and 13 points sharing his 9th position with nigel mansell
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: senna did not just race in formula one that year
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he also co drove a porsche 956 with henri pescarolo and stefan johansson in the 1000km nurburgring race
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he also raced in a race to celebrate the opening of the new nurburgring
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he won this race
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the following year joined the lotus team and many thought he would be able to meet his potential
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the other driver for lotus was elio de angelis
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ayrton scored his first of 65 pole positions in his career during the brazilian grand prix but was not able to win the race
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he retired with an electrical problem after 48 laps
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he did not had to wait a long time for his first ever victory in formula 1 however because he won the next race the portuguese grand prix starting off from pole position again
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he showed his true talent driving in such bad weather which even later champion alain prost could not race in he spun into a wall
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the rest of the season was not too good for senna though
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he scored a lot of points but often retired because of mechanical problems
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he won the belgian grand prix in another wet race and finished 4th at the end of the season scoring 38 points total
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he also took two first places two second places two third places and seven pole positions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his second season with lotus in 1986 was better than his first
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the lotus car was a lot more reliable
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he finished second in the brazilian grand prix with only nelson piquet being faster than ayrton
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he even took the lead in the world championship standings during the spanish grand prix after managing to keep nigel mansell away from stealing the victory
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the gap between both drivers was only 14 thousand of a second
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he did not have a lot of time to enjoy his lead however because his lotus did not have the reliability ayrton needed to chase after the title
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: key races in bold indicate pole position races in italics indicate fastest lap
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in common law an indictment is a charge saying that a person committed a very serious crime
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they used to be given out by grand juries a special jury usually made up of 24 people that is used to see if a person should be charged but many places do not have grand juries anymore
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sealed indictments are kept secret until they are unsealed

lines.value: denmark (), officially named the kingdom of denmark is a nordic country in northern europe
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is the furthest south of the scandinavian countries to the south of norway and south west of sweden which it is connected to by a bridge
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has a south border with germany
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it borders both the north sea to the west and the baltic sea to the east
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: denmark is a developed country with a large welfare state in 2006 and 2007 surveys ranked denmark as the happiest place in the world based on standards of health welfare and education
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the capital city of denmark is copenhagen on the island of sealand
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: denmark is a constitutional monarchy meaning the head of state is a monarch who has few established powers with a queen margrethe ii
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: denmark is a parliamentary state meaning the people appoint a parliament to make decisions for them and it has a democratic government headed by an elected prime minister who currently is lars lokke rasmussen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in geography denmark is the land in northern europe where the danes live
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the political sense the kingdom of denmark also includes the faroe islands in the atlantic ocean and greenland in north america
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all three parts of the country have different languages and culture
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: denmark was first united in the 10th century during the viking period by the king harald bluetooth (), who first converted denmark to christianity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the vikings are well known for invading countries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the 11th century the danish vikings controlled england the danelaw for a while
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1397 denmark sweden and norway became a single country with one queen this country was called the kalmar union sweden became a separate country again in 1523
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: denmark and norway called denmark norway stayed united until 1814
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: denmark norway controlled many islands in the atlantic ocean including the faroe islands iceland and greenland
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: iceland became independent from denmark in 1944
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: denmark became a constitutional monarchy in june 5 1849 when it adopted a constitution which took away powers from the king and gave rights to ordinary danish people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: june 5 is now a holiday in denmark called constitution day
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: over the years denmark lost many of the lands that it controlled in battle
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: denmark's biggest war defeat was the second schleswig war in 1864 when the duchies of schleswig and holstein was conquered by the kingdom prussia now a part of germany
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was a big loss for denmark and consequently it began a policy of neutrality after the loss meaning it would no longer take part in any wars or support other countries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: denmark did not take part in the first world war
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on april 9 1940 denmark was invaded by nazi germany and the nazis stayed in denmark throughout world war ii
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during the war in 1943 danes helped over 8000 jews to escape from denmark into sweden after the nazis tried to arrest them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after the liberation of denmark one part of the country was not
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that was the island of bornholm
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the german commandant von kamptz who was stationed there refused to surrender to the soviets as the german were fleeing to bornholm and further to sweden
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the soviets then bombed the two biggest towns ronne and nexo
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after the germans were captured on may 9 1945 the soviet army occupied the island until april 6 1946
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after world war two denmark became a member of nato and the european union
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: greenland and the faroe islands are now part of the kingdom of denmark and have their own governments and limited power
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: denmark has three branches of power the judiciary the courts the executive the prime minister and the cabinet and the legislature the danish parliament
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the current prime minister of denmark is lars lokke rasmussen who was elected in june 2015
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: denmark is a kingdom which means it has a monarch a king or queen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the current monarch is queen margrethe ii
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: margrethe ii does not have a lot of power she does not make any important decisions and has a symbolic role
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: denmark became a constitutional monarchy in 1849
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: elections to the parliament are held every four years and the winner of the election is the party or coalition which gets the most votes and seats in the parliament
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after the elections are done several parties who are in agreement will group together to form a coalition government and the leader of the largest party becomes the prime minister
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: here is a short summary of the biggest political parties in denmark from left to right on the political axis
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: denmark like the other nordic countries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: is well known for being a large welfare state
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the government provides many services to the public such as free health care free education school and college and free housing for the poor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: danes pay high taxes to fund welfare
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: denmark is the smallest of the scandinavian countries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the neighbours are germany to the south sweden to the east norway to the north and the united kingdom to the west
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the country is surrounded by the sea except for jutland jylland the largest part of denmark
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is connected to germany by land
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to the south east there is the baltic sea to the west the north sea to the north the skagerrak and to the north east the kattegat
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the western part of denmark is the peninsula of jutland (, pronounced yoo'-land bordering germany
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is the only part of denmark that is not an island
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the rest of denmark includes 76 islands people live on and many tiny islands
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the largest islands are zealand sjalland and funen fyn
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to the east is the island of bornholm in the baltic sea the only place in denmark where the bedrock can be seen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the country is quite flat
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the highest hill or mountain is mollehoj which is 170.86 metres 560.56 ft tall
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are many small hills lakes creeks forests and farmland
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: denmark's shore line covers 7314 km 4545 mi
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: nobody in denmark lives more than 60 km from the coast
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the weather in denmark is quite windy and rainy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the winter it does not get very cold in most years there are only a few weeks of snow
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: every ten years or so the sea around the islands freezes over but in most winters it does not
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the climate and topography are not good for winter sports
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most summers are not very hot
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people always dress to be ready for rain or wind
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are also very sunny times but nobody can know ahead of time when these will be
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the best time of the year for outdoor activities is the months of may and june until midsummer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: denmark is divided into five regions danish regioner or region for one
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the regions replaced the former counties amter in january 2007
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the regions are in charge of hospitals and health care
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the regions are then subdivided into municipalities ().
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are currently 98 municipalities but before january 2007 there were 275
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the number of municipalities was decreased when it was decided that to become more efficient each should have a population of at least 20000
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the biggest part 90.5% of denmark's population of just under 5.4 million is of danish descent according to 2009 statistics
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: of the rest 8.9% who are immigrants or descendent from recent immigrants many come from south asia or the middle east
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are also small groups of inuit from greenland and faroese
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the danes speak the national language danish which is very similar to the other scandinavian languages
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: swedish and norwegian are so close to danish that most danes understand them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as well as danish most danes speak a foreign language too such as english which is popular as an international language or german
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the southern part of jutland a german minority speaks german
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on the faroe islands faroese is spoken and people living in greenland speak inuit
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: religion does not play a large part in the life of most danes and church attendance is very low
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however even though many danes are atheist 80.4% are members of the protestant church of denmark (, the national church which is the official state church of denmark
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the national church is lutheran which means it separated from the roman catholic church in the 16th century
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other important faiths include judaism islam the number of muslims is increasing other protestant groups and catholicism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because of the many islands denmark has many bridges
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the main parts of the country and most of the bigger islands are connected by roads and railroads
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one of the world's longest bridges connects the eastern and the western parts of the country and there is a large bridge to sweden also
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is still no bridge across the baltic sea to germany but it will most likely be built in a few years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the bridge to sweden was expensive took a long time to build and required much planning by engineers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are still many islands with no bridges to the mainland
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people have to go by boat or airplane to reach these islands

lines.value: many islands will never be reached by bridges because they are too small or too far away

lines.value: if the island has too few people bridges are often not built because it is expensive to build

lines.value: cycling is very popular in denmark because the ground is so flat

lines.value: copenhagen is a city that is very bicycle friendly with bicycle lanes extending over 12000 km

lines.value: the people of denmark have always depended on the sea

lines.value: in earlier days people could not travel anywhere unless they went by boat

lines.value: many danes were fishermen or merchants

lines.value: even today many danes spend much time near or at the sea

lines.value: farming has always been one of the main occupations

lines.value: because of the climate and the soil denmark is a good place for agriculture

lines.value: danish hams and cookies are exported throughout the world

lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the play was based on an old danish myth of the viking prince amled of jutland and his quest for revenge against his father's killer

lines.value: also karen blixen tycho brahe and the philosopher soren kierkegaard are well known world wide

lines.value: ecological yield is the harvestable growth of an ecosystem
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is most commonly measured in forestry in fact sustainable forestry is defined as that which does not harvest more wood in a year than has grown in that year within a given patch of forest

lines.value: however the concept is also applicable to water and soil and any other aspect of an ecosystem which can be both harvested and renewed the so called renewable resources

lines.value: the carrying capacity of an ecosystem is reduced over time if more than the amount which is renewed refreshed or regrown or rebuilt

lines.value: scientists say that there are no real ghosts but many people believe that there are

lines.value: a first of its kind documentary on the subject of ghosts and the hereafter will be released this summer 2017 covering all the currently available scientific and historical evidence related to the subject matter

lines.value: socialism is an economic system where the ways of making money factories offices etc are owned by a society as a whole meaning the value made belongs to everyone in that society instead of a group of private owners
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people who agree with this type of system are called socialists
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are two ways socialists think that society can own the means of making wealth either the state government of the country is used or worker owned cooperatives are used
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: another important belief is that management and sharing are supposed to be based on public interests
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: socialists believe that everything in society is made by the cooperative efforts of the people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are many kinds of socialism so no one definition can apply to all of them however in all types the workers supposedly own the means of production
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the major differences between the different varieties are the role of the free market or planning how the means of production are controlled the role of management of workers and the government's role in the economy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in some major societies whose governments have called themselves socialist corruption and lack of incentive for workers to produce have reduced production and the average standard of living
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: similar kinds of corruption have had other negative effects on societies considered capitalist
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however in many of the societies of western europe which have adopted progress toward democratic socialism productivity standards of living incentives and markers of personal happiness and security are very high
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: even though this has never yet happened some socialists believe that socialism will over time turn into what they see as a more advanced system with no state money or social classes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because the tools for making and distributing things are owned by everyone in socialism more jobs will be replaced by machines until the amount of human work needed is made as low as possible so they say that this will let everyone get what they want without using money
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is called communism and these socialists are called communists
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: socialism is an economic theory of social organization that believes that the means of making moving and trading wealth should be owned or controlled by the community as a whole
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in marxist theory it is a transitional temporary in between social state between capitalism and communism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: social democracy is a kind of socialism that tries to mix parts of socialism with capitalism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in this system the government takes wealth money from the rich and gives it to the poor like in a communist state but despite there being more government control and less chance to make a very large amount of money people can still run their own businesses and own private property
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: unlike communism where all private property is taken to be owned publicly people and businesses pay taxes on their property and this money is spent on public services see below after taking out the costs of running the government and collecting the taxes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the main method of democratic socialism is changing society through slow reform rather than a quick revolution
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in many countries that use social democracy some services and industries are subsidized given money to help them run and or partly controlled by the government
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example education health care housing utility companies and public transportation are some industries that might be owned supported by the government in a socialist system
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for the most part people working in these industries are paid by the government with money paid by the people as taxes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: welfare is also likely offered under socialism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: another kind of socialism is collectivization in this system money and goods are shared more equally among the people with the government in control
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in theory this system results in the gap between classes getting smaller with the poorest of a nation's people being helped by the state while the richest agree to higher taxes and economic controls restrictions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: of course socialism as it is commonly used is different in many ways from communism see the history of socialism and communism later in the article today many democratic socialists especially in western europe australia and new zealand want industries to be guided jointly together by representatives of shareholders people who own part of the business as well as the workers working together in what is known as an industrial democracy because both groups want the business to do well
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this would be a more direct democratic way of organizing rather than control by central government
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: trade unions and or workers councils would represent the interests of the employees
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many countries see socialism differently
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: socialist international is an organization dedicated to the cause of promoting socialist ideals and has ties with many socialist parties especially social democratic parties
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most non communist people say communism when they mean the marxist and leninist ideas of russia's bolshevik party

lines.value: marx believed that capitalism followed the economic and political system of feudalism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he also believed that capitalism would oppress treat unfairly many people and those people would eventually revolt and change to socialism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: then he thought that socialism can be another bridge but to communism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however many people incorrectly use the term communist to refer to a socialist state
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: others call this state socialism to distinguish it from the communist goal that does not need a state or any form of government
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to non communists the word socialism is now mostly used for attempts to come close to this goal in a democratic state
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: action theory is an area in philosophy that talks about theories about the processes that cause intentional willful human body movements
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some philosophers ask the question what is an action or what makes somebody do an action
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: here are two theories
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some philosophers say that an action is caused by a person wanting something and thinking that by doing that action they can get it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example if i want an apple and think that by walking to a table with some apples on it i can get one then i will walk to the table
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is important to have both a want desire and a thought about how to get it belief
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if i think that by walking to a table with some apples on it i can get an apple but want an orange and not an apple then i will not walk to the table
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if i want an apple but think that the table across the room is just a picture of a table then i will not walk to the table
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other philosophers say that the want think theory is not true
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they say that it is my brain and my nerves that causes an action
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they see the brain as working like a computer that directs small electric packages from some nerves to other nerves and stores some for a while in memory
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these packages cannot be named they are just like computer bits and bytes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these philosophers say that we talk about what we want and what we think because the brain is very complicated and we do not understand it yet
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these questions form part of the philosophy of mind
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the recorder is a musical instrument that is a type of flute

lines.value: these instruments are louder than the recorder and are better for playing difficult music

lines.value: plastic recorders were invented in the 20th century
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are cheap and vary greatly in quality that is often not related to the price depending on the manufacturer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are easy instruments to play simple music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many elementary schools use plastic recorders to teach music to children
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the head joint of the recorder is used as a noise rhythm and effect instrument and as a toy musical instrument with children
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because the recorder head works like a whistle it can be used as such
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: with a bit practice it is easy to play all kind of rhythms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: effects are made by opening and covering the lower end of the head joint with the hand while blowing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many players blow harder like normal recorder playing like with a pea whistle to get a very shrill and loud sound
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: professor agnes dorwarth of the hochschule fur musik freiburg argues this is an attractive way to get children to play with part of the instrument which can make playing the entire instrument more inviting
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: recorders are made in different sizes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the lowest note of most recorders is either c or f this is the note that is heard when the player covers all the finger holes and the thumb hole
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the soprano recorder is the size of recorder which is usually played in schools also known as a descant
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the lowest note of the soprano recorder is c some recorders are smaller than the soprano recorder but are not common
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the alto recorder is bigger than the soprano recorder
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: its lowest is f the other main sizes are the tenor recorder with lowest note c and the bass with lowest note f
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: instruments larger than the bass are made but are not common
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these include the great bass contrabass subgreatbass and subcontrabass
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: recorders higher than a soprano recorder include the sopranino and garklein recorders
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the recorder is a very social instrument
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many people enjoy playing in small or large groups
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: groups often play music that is written for several different sizes of recorder together
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: often there is a separate musical part for soprano alto tenor and bass recorders
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this covers a wider range of notes from high sounds to low than any single instrument could play
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some music is written for a recorder duet two instruments trio three or quartet four
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these groups are called s from the french word for some people play in recorder orchestras
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these sometimes have 50 or 60 players with nine sizes of instrument

lines.value: franz peter schubert 31 january 1797 vienna 19 november 1828 vienna was an austrian composer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: although he died at the age of 31 he composed over one thousand pieces of music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there were other great composers who lived and worked in vienna haydn mozart and beethoven but schubert is the only one who was born in vienna
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was the last great composer of the classical music period and one of the first of the romantic period
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: schubert's father was a schoolteacher
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: twelve children were born into the family but only four of them lived to become adults
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: schubert's father tried to persuade his sons to help at the school when they grew up
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as a boy the young franz learned the violin piano organ singing and harmony
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he soon became very good at them all
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his teachers were all amazed at how quickly he learned
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was also very good at other subjects in school
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the holidays he played string quartets with his two brothers and his father
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he wrote his first string quartets for them to play
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by the age of 16 he had composed a lot of music including his first symphony
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his mother died
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his father soon remarried
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his stepmother was very kind to him and often lent him money
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he had one strange thumb on his right hand
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by the age of 17 schubert was teaching at his father's school
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he had been rejected by the army because he was too short shorter than five feet and his sight was very poor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he still had composition lessons from antonio salieri
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he often went to the opera where he heard some of the finest music of the time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he liked reading
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one of his favourite books was goethe's faust
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he wrote a song called gretchen am spinnrade which is about the young girl in the book sitting at a spinning wheel dreaming of her lover
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the piano has a gentle accompaniment which sounds like the throbbing of the spinning wheel
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the music stops for a moment when the girl imagines her lover is kissing her then the piano gradually starts again
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is a very famous song
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: another song which soon made him famous in all europe was erlkonig
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when it was first published another composer whose name was also franz schubert thought that somebody had published a song in his name because the music publishers sent it to him for correction
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he sent a very angry letter back saying he had not composed that rubbish
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was difficult to find enough time to compose because he was a teacher
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a man called schober persuaded schubert to give up teaching so that he could spend all his time composing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: soon he had become well known in all the drawing rooms in vienna where he met famous people many of them musicians
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these meetings were called schubertiads because they played and sang his music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he wrote so many wonderful pieces that it seems strange that the music publishers did not want to publish them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they were only interested in publishing works written by performers but were not very interested in people like schubert who just composed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for a time he became music teacher for the two princesses of count johann esterhazy but then he returned to vienna to live with the schober family
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during the last few years of his life schubert was ill
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he had to leave the schober's house and find his own rooms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was often desperately poor and composed in bed to keep warm
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: although beethoven and schubert lived in the same town they only met once although they knew one another's music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: schubert visited beethoven on 19 march 1827
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: beethoven was dying
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: schubert was one of the torch bearers at his funeral
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a year and a half later schubert too had died
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he asked to be buried near beethoven
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: their graves were just three places apart
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: schubert's songs are among the greatest ever written
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are all settings of german poems
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: german art songs are called lieder pronounced leader and schubert made his lieder very special by making the piano accompaniments describe the action of the songs in many different ways
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if you try to sing them in a translation it is difficult to make it sound good
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is best to hear them in german and to have a translation so that you understand what is being sung
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some of the last songs he wrote make up a cycle called die winterreise the winter journey
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the poems are about a man who is unhappy because his lover does not want him
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he goes out into the cold winter woods and all nature seems to reflect the way he feels inside
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the songs are usually sung by a male singer tenor baritone or bass
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: schubert wrote a great deal of chamber music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: among his most famous pieces are several string quartets a string quintet for 2 violins viola and 2 cellos and the trout quintet for piano violin viola cello and double bass
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are sonatas and sonatinas for violin and piano and a sonata for an instrument called the arpeggione which was used for about ten years after it was invented and then it was forgotten
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the sonata is normally played on a cello or a viola nowadays
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is lots of piano music including sonatas impromptus and also piano duet music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: schubert wrote eight famous impromptus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: schubert wrote nine symphonies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the last one is known as the great symphony in c major
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the eighth is called the unfinished
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are only two movements instead of the usual four
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a lot of people still argue about why he left it unfinished
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some people even think that he completed it and that the last two movements are either lost or are now known as movements from a piano duet
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: we shall probably never know for certain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most of his life he was supported by his friends who gave him manuscript paper when he could not afford it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many of his greatest works only became widely known in the 1860s long after his death
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the house in vienna where schubert was born is now a museum which people can visit
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: flatworms platyhelminthes greek platy flat helminth worm are a phylum of invertebrates
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are relatively simple animals
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they have bodies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: with about 25000 known species they are the largest phylum of animals without a body cavity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: flatworms can be found in marine freshwater and even damp terrestrial environments
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a troublesome terrestrial example is the new zealand flatworm arthurdendyus triangulatus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is an invasive species which colonized large areas of ireland and scotland
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was brought there by accident in the 1960s
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: since then it has destroyed most of the indigenous earthworms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: holi most flatworms over 50% are parasitic on other animals
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are four classes *turbellaria free living flatworms sometimes called planarians
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: planaria is actually a genus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: flatworms are one of the invertebrate groups which are studied in school biology
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the main reason for this is that they may infect humans pets and farmyard animals and this was a problem
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some do enormous harm to humans and their livestock
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: schistosomiasis caused by one genus of trematodes is the second most devastating of all human diseases caused by parasites surpassed only by malaria
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: effective treatments are now available for these infections
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: also in first world countries regulations on domestic cattle prevent infected meat from reaching the human hosts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during the great plague of london 1665-1666 the disease called the bubonic plague killed about 200000 people in london england
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in seven months almost one quarter of london's population one out of every four londoners died from the plague
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at its worst in september of 1665 the plague killed 7165 people in one week
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after this the number of people dying from the plague began to slow down
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: around september of 1666 the great outbreak ended
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the great fire of london which happened on 2-3 september 1666 may have helped end the outbreak by killing many of the rats and fleas who were spreading the plague
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: though most of the people who died during the great plague lived in london the plague also killed people in other areas of england
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by the time the great plague ended about 2.5% of england's population had died from the plague
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to compare about 2% of the entire united kingdom's population including soldiers and civilians died in world war i and about 1% of the entire united kingdom's population died in world war ii
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the great plague of 1665 was the last major plague in england
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: before the great plague england had had outbreaks of plague meaning many people got the disease every few decades
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example in london the first places hit by the plague were the dock areas outside of the city and the parish of st giles in the fields
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in these places poor workers lived crowded together in bad conditions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: nobody kept records about the deaths of very poor people so nobody knows how many of these people may have died from the plague
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however records say the first person to die of the plague in london was rebecca andrews on 12 april 1665
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by july 1665 plague was in the city of london itself
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many of the people who could afford to leave the city left for the countryside
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: king charles ii of england his family and his court left the city for oxfordshire
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most wealthy merchants and professionals left the city so most businesses were closed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as the plague got worse more and more people left
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: london got so empty that grass started to grow on the streets
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however most of the city's government officials stayed in london
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: so did the lord mayor of london sir john lawrence
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as the plague got worse more and more people left but a small number of clergymen physicians and apothecaries chose to stay
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: also people who were too poor to move to the countryside had no choice but to stay in the city
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some of the people who stayed in london wrote about the great plague
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: samuel pepys's diary about living through the plague has given historians a lot of information about what the plague was like
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: henry foe a saddler who lived in east london also decided not to leave the city
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: years later in 1722 foe's nephew daniel defoe wrote a journal of the plague year a story about the plague which he may have based on foe's journals
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people in london tried many different things to try to treat the plague and stop it from spreading
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at the time nobody understood what caused the plague how it spread or how to treat it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: p.42 antibiotic medications which are the only treatment for plague would not be discovered for another 300 years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people were so afraid of catching the plague from other people that they threw dead plague victims bodies in overcrowded pits and buried them all together as quickly as possible
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in one parish in london 1114 dead plague victims were buried together in a hole that was fifty feet long and twenty feet wide
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pp.174-175 as the plague got worse people began to do worse things
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some people refused to help sick family members
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other people forced sick servants to leave even though they had nowhere to go
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eventually if one person in a home got the plague the whole family was forced to stay in the home
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a red cross and the words lord have mercy upon us would be painted on the door
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: samuel pepys wrote in his diary the plague [is] making us cruel as dogs to one another government officials tried several public health programs to prevent more people from getting the plague
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example though the plague was worst in london it also affected other parts of england
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: perhaps the most famous example was the village of eyam in derbyshire
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: nobody knows for sure how the plague got to eyam
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however stories say that a merchant carrying cloth from london accidentally brought the plague with him
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the villagers quarantined themselves kept themselves apart from other people and other villages to make sure the disease would not spread any further
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this kept the plague from spreading outside eyam
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however about 80% of the people in eyam died from the plague within a little over a year
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as time went on more and more people died from the plague
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this continued until the week of 19-26 september 1665
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was the worst week of the great plague 7165 people died from the plague in that week
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after that the number of deaths from the plague began to slow down
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by february 1666 the king and his court decided it was safe enough to return to london
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some people though not nearly so many continued to get the plague until september 1666
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: around that time the plague outbreak ended
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the great fire of london which destroyed most of the centre of london may have helped

lines.value: a boomerang is a flying tool that is best known for its ability to return to the thrower
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the past it was made of wood but most of the modern boomerangs are made of other materials
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most people know that australian aborigines used boomerangs for hunting
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but the oldest boomerang was found in a cave in poland and is more than 20000 twenty thousand years old
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this kind of boomerang does not return to the thrower but it can fly longer distances and more stably than other things which can be thrown
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these days returning boomerangs are usually used for recreation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most of the boomerangs do not have the classical l shape
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the modern boomerang is special in that it will return to the one who threw it if it is thrown correctly
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however some boomerangs do not return because their wings do not have the right profile
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most of the boomerangs are made for right handed use
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: left handed people have to use other boomerangs that are mirror inverted or have to throw with their right hand
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a boomerang is not thrown like a frisbee
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has to be thrown almost vertically with an inclination of about 10 20 degrees and with a lot of rotation spin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when facing the wind throw with an angle of 30 45 degrees to the right left-handed to the left of the wind
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: be sure to choose a field that is big enough
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: watch out for passers by and do not throw when people are standing in the range of the boomerang
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: see also the link provided in the section below

lines.value: there are a lot of boomerang clubs in many countries all over the world

lines.value: these clubs organise workshops and tournaments
