lines.value: the best boomerang throwers come from australia france germany japan switzerland and the united states of america

lines.value: computer science is the study of how to manipulate manage transform and encode information
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are many different areas in computer science
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some of the areas consider problems in an way
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some areas need special machines called computers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a person who works with computers will often need mathematics science and logic in order to make and use computers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is so that they can find new and easier ways to do things and the way to approach problems with this information
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: computers can do some things easily for example simple math or sorting out a list of names from a to z
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but computers cannot answer questions when there is not enough information or when there is no real answer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: also computers may take too much time to finish long
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example it may take too long to find the shortest way through all of the towns in the usa so instead a computer will try to make a close guess
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a computer will answer these simpler questions much faster
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: algorithms are a specific set of instructions or steps on how to complete a task
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: think about playing cards for example
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a computer scientist wants to sort these cards
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are many ways to sort the cards
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the sorting can be by suits diamonds clubs hearts and spades or by numbers 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 10 jack queen king and ace
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by deciding on a set of steps of how to sort the cards the scientist has created an algorithm
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after making the algorithm the scientist needs to test whether the algorithm works
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this shows how well and how fast the algorithm sorts cards
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a simple but slow algorithm could be drop the cards pick them up and check whether they are sorted
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if they are not do it again
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this method will work but it will take a very long time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a better algorithm would be find the first card with the smallest suit and smallest number 2 of diamonds and put it at the start
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after this he looks for the second card and so on
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this works much faster and does not need much space
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this sorting algorithm is called selection sort
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ada lovelace wrote the first computer algorithm in 1843 for a computer that was never finished
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: computers began during world war ii
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: computer science separated from the other sciences during the 1960s and 1970s
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: now computer science has its own methods and has its own technical terms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is related to electrical engineering mathematics and language science
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: computer science looks at the theoretical parts of computers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: computer engineering looks at the physical parts of computers hardware
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: software engineering looks at the use of computer programs and how to make them

lines.value: metallurgy is the study of metals
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: alloys mixtures of metals are also studied
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people who study or work with metals are called metallurgists
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ores are rocks that have a chemical compound of a metal with oxygen called an oxide
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: separating the oxygen from the metal is called smelting
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is done with chemistry or electricity usually at very high temperatures
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is the first step in metallurgy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a rock containing enough metal to be profitable is called ore
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: iron is smelted from iron ore in large reactors called blast furnaces
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a blast furnace is a tall vertical structure which is fed with coke iron ore and limestone
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when hot air is blown in the blast furnace the coke will burn and reduce the oxygen off the ore producing bare iron and carbon dioxide
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the limestone will bind off any remaining bedrock
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the iron melts in the hot temperature and is tapped off in liquid phase at the bottom
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is then worked into steel
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the limestone and bedrock form a compound called slag
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it can be used for making bricks concrete or road topping
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: aluminum is smelted in electric ovens called electric arc furnaces
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the aluminum ore is poured on the bottom of the furnace and electric current is led through the ore
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the temperature rises so high that the oxygen separates leaving metallic aluminum
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: copper is poured on naked flame which burns off sulfur and other impurities leaving raw copper
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: electrolysis uses electric current to separate the copper in big pools which contain water solution called electrolyte
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an electric current is led in the pool and all copper will gather on the electrode called cathode
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: another part of metallurgy is making parts from metals
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these parts must be made so they will not break when they are used
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: metallurgists work to make the metal good when they are used
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sometimes the metal must be strong
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other times it must be tough not easily broken
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the metallurgist must follow directions when making the part to know what metal to use
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: steel has a low cost but rusts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: choosing a good metal is sometimes hard
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a metal starts as a block called an ingot
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: metallurgists must know how to make a metal part from an ingot
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: parts are made from ingots different ways
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when a big hammer is used it is called forging
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to make thin metals a metal is put between two rolls and moved called rolling
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: making metal hot makes it easier to change the shape of a metal part
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for this reason most metal parts are made using hot metal
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is hot work
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: two metal parts can be put together with much heat
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is called welding
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: iron is easy to weld
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: metallurgists use many tools to know what to do to the metal
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the most useful is the microscope
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the microscope gives much information about the way the metal moves
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: metals are sometimes pulled until they break
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is the tension test
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some useful information can be gotten from this test

lines.value: george harrison mbe 25 february 1943 - 29 november 2001 was an english musician
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was born and grew up in liverpool england and was first famous as a member of the beatles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after the group broke up in 1970 he had a solo career
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he made many albums and worked with other musicians including eric clapton bob dylan phil spector roy orbison tom petty and ravi shankar
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was also interested in eastern mysticism and charitable causes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: george's best known album was all things must pass which he made just after the beatles broke up
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: harrison owned a in england called friar park where he lived from 1970 until he died
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he built his own inside the mansion which for a time was better than abbey road studios where the beatles had made their records
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: having a private studio meant harrison could work on songs and recordings anytime he wanted
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ravi shankar came to harrison during 1971 with news about a war in bangladesh where thousands of people had died and millions more were refugees and starving
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: shankar asked for harrison's help to give a benefit show to buy food for them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: harrison called on many of his musician friends who put together an charity concert to help the refugees
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the concert for bangla desh a live recording became a best selling album raised money for the refugees and brought worldwide attention to the problems in their country
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it also inspired later benefits including live aid in the 1980s
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: harrison found a new musical partner in the 1980s when jeff lynne of electric light orchestra began to write and record songs with him
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the two men worked well together and became close friends
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: harrison and lynne formed another band the traveling wilburys with fellow musicians bob dylan tom petty and roy orbison
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the traveling wilburys recorded two albums which became hits
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1966 harrison married a model pattie boyd but they were divorced in 1971 and had no children
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: boyd left harrison to be with his friend guitarist eric clapton but all three remained friends
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: harrison married again in 1978 to american born olivia trinidad arias who had worked for his record company
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: arias became the mother of harrison's son dhani whose name is comprised of the names of two notes in the indian music scale
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: dhani grew up to be a musician like his father fronting the band thenewno2
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he went to brown university in the united states
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the late 1970s harrison formed a movie production company handmade films which produced movies including monty python's life of brian and terry gilliam's time bandits
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the grounds of harrison's home friar park had been more or less open to the public until the murder of his former bandmate john lennon late in 1980
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: harrison was very hurt and shocked by lennon's death and was afraid someone might try to harm him or his family
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: afterwards the gates were locked and no entry notices were posted
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in december 1999 an intruder broke into his home stabbing him with a knife
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: harrison and his wife olivia stopped the intruder and called the police
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: harrison recovered
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the man who attacked him is schizophrenic and was acquitted of attempted murder by reason of insanity in november 2000 at oxford crown court
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was sent to a mental hospital and released in 2002
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the 1990s decades of smoking cigarettes caused harrison to develop throat cancer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he later developed lung cancer which caused his death in 2001
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his family issued a last statement from him everything else can wait but the search for god cannot wait and love one another even music was not as important to harrison as his wanting people to learn to get along with each other and to make the world a better place
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a year after harrison's death jeff lynne dhani harrison the two remaining beatles paul mccartney and ringo starr and other musicians held the concert for george which remembered harrison's music his life and his gifts to humanity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all the profits from the concert were given to charity

lines.value: the london underground is a system of electric trains which are in london united kingdom
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is the oldest underground railway in the world
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it started running in 1863 as the metropolitan railway
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after the opening the system was copied in many other cities for example new york and madrid
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: even though it is called the underground about half of it is above the ground
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the tube is a slang name for the london underground because the tunnels for some of the lines are round tubes running through the ground
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the underground has got 274 stations and over 408 km of track
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: from 2006 2007 over 1 billion passengers used the underground
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: underground train systems in other cities may be called metros like the tyne and wear metro in north east england or subways glasgow subway in scotland and in most of north america
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: subway is used across britain to refer to underground walkways
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the metropolitan line was the first part of the underground to be made
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was opened in 1863
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it then ran between paddington and farringdon
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it took 40000 passengers per day
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: later it was made longer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the district line was built by a different company
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1884 the circle line was finished
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all these lines used steam engines at first
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1890 a line using electric trains was opened
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was much deeper below ground than the other lines
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: now it is part of the northern line
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: more lines like this were opened
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people liked them so in 1905 the lines that used steam engines were changed to use electric trains
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because the different lines were run by different companies changing lines was difficult
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: between 1900 and 1902 charles yerkes bought most of the companies and formed a company named underground electric railways of london company ltd short uerl
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1933 a company was formed of all the bus tram and underground companies called london passenger transport board lptb
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it planned to make the network longer but the second world war stopped this
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the war some underground stations were used as shelters against bombs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after the war more passengers used the underground
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: minor changes were made victoria line was opened in the 1960s and currently the piccadilly line was extended to heathrow airport in 1977
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the jubilee line was opened in 1979 and extended to stratford 20 years later
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: night tube was introduced in 2016
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the system uses two kinds of trains a big type called sub surface trains and a smaller type deep level trains
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the big ones are used for the rectangular tunnels district line metropolitan line circle line the small ones for the round tunnels
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most lines have different trains although they fit into one of the two categories
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the underground's trains usually drive to 270 stations
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: 14 stations are outside of london
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the underground uses zones to collect fares
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are 9 zones
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: zone 1 is the most central zone
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the only london underground stations in zones 7 to 9 are on the metropolitan line beyond moor park outside greater london
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some stations are in two zones and the cheapest fare applies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: paper tickets or the contactless oyster card can be used for travel
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the oyster card is a plastic card which stores credit money and travelcards which the owner uses to pay for underground travel
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the user must charge put money onto their card at a ticket machine
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they then touch the card on a yellow reader to pay for their journey
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: since its introduction in 2002 it has become very popular with regular travelers as the prices are much cheaper if you use an oyster card
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are ticket offices some open only in the rush hour and ticket machines which can be used at any time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some machines take coins only other touch screen machines take coins and english notes and usually give change
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these machines also take credit and debit cards some newer machines accept cards only
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the following tickets are available from london underground and tfl ticket offices to use on the underground
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when most of the stations in the london underground system were built disabled and wheelchair access was not considered
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: while many above ground stations have only a few steps to the platform nearly all underground stations have some of the systems's 410 escalators and 112 lifts elevators
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: newer stations include disabled access and many older stations install disabled access when they are refurbished or rebuilt
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: since 2004 maps inside the trains show which stations have step free access from street level
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: transport for london plan to have a network of over 100 fully accessible stations by 2020 which means that 75% of tube journeys can be made with step free access
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the escalators in the london underground system are some of the longest in europe
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the cello also has 4 strings
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the cello developed as the bass instrument in string groups the double bass was added later doubling the bass i.e playing the same as the cello an octave lower
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was used to accompany in basso continuo playing the same as the left hand of the harpsichord player
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when composers started to write concerti grossi pieces for orchestra and a small group of soloists they started to give the cello small solos
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in this way the cello started to be used as a solo instrument as well
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: johann sebastian bach wrote six very famous suites for solo cello unaccompanied
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are among the most beautiful pieces written for the cello
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other composers started to write works for solo cello
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: joseph haydn wrote two solo concertos for the instrument
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: king friedrich wilhelm ii of prussia loved the cello and he inspired haydn mozart and beethoven to write music with interesting cello parts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the cello was now an equal with the other string instruments no longer just playing a simple bass line
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the 19th century many famous composers wrote cello music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a lot of them were cellists themselves e.g carl davidov david popper and julius klengel
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some very famous composers who wrote important cello music were mendelssohn chopin schumann brahms dvorak faure saint saens elgar sergei rakhmaninov
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: two famous pieces written more recently for cello and orchestra are the cello symphony by benjamin britten and the protecting veil by john tavener
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the parts of the cello are similar to those of the violin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the strings are tuned to c g d a low to high
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the cello is played sitting down and holding the instrument between the knees
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is an end pin which rests on the ground
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is adjustable in height so that the player can put it in a position to make himself herself comfortable
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the cello is normally played with a bow
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the cello has a deep rich sound
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it starts one octave below middle e but can go very high
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for the highest notes the player can use thumb position a violinist cannot do this
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this means that the left thumb is pressing down on one or two strings high up over the fingerboard high means nearer the bridge where the high notes are
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in fact it is nearer to the floor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: although cello music is most frequently written in the bass clef cello music often goes quite high so that the tenor clef is used especially in the solo repertory
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the most famous cellist of the early part of the 1900s was the spanish cellist pablo casals
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he made the cello popular as a solo instrument today
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: casals also discovered the famous suites for cello by js bach which had been lost
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some other famous cellists of the last century include emanuel feuermann gregor piatigorski paul tortelier jacqueline du pre and mstislav rostropovich
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: cellists of today include yo yo ma julian lloyd webber octavia philharmonica mischa maisky tim hugh robert cohen pieter wispelwey and truls mork

lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however there are many mantras which are just syllables with or without any words
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: such mantras do not carry meanings

lines.value: from the ancient times hindus as well as in many cases texts of buddhism and jainism contain many mantras
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: traditionally people associate the mantras with various powers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however it is more a matter of individual faith and experience than a fact of science
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the earliest examples of mantras are many hymns and verses of vedas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people read them aloud
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they thought that by doing so they would get the blessings of the gods and other beings
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the system continued in hindu practices of worship and meditation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: even now many hindus believe in the power of mantras to gain health and wealth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mantras may form part of worship or people may simply recite them loudly or slowly

lines.value: the aardwolf proteles cristata is a small insectivorous mammal native to east africa and southern africa
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: its name means earth wolf in the afrikaans dutch language
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is also called maanhaar jackal in afrikaans or civet hyena based on the secretions civet from their anal glands
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the aardwolf is in the same family as the hyenas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: unlike many of its relatives in the order carnivora the aardwolf does not hunt large animals or even eat meat on a regular basis instead it eats insects mainly termites - one aardwolf can eat about 250000 termites during a single night by using its long sticky tongue to capture them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the aardwolf lives in the scrublands of eastern and southern africa - these are open lands covered with stunted trees and shrubs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the aardwolf is nocturnal resting in burrows during the day and coming out at night to eat
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: dame jane goodall dbe born in london on 3 april 1934 is a zoologist
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: jane goodall is a british primatologist ethologist ,and anthropologist
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she is also the un messenger of peace
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she is the world's foremost expert on chimpanzees
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: goodall is best known for her 45-year study of social and family interactions of wild chimpanzees in gombe stream national park tanzania
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she is the founder of the jane goodall institute and has worked extensively on conservation and animal welfare issues
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she has been interested in animals since childhood
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as a child she was given a lifelike chimpanzee toy named jubilee by her father her fondness for the toy started her early love of animals
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the reason the chimpanzee's name is jubilee is because in 1935 there had been a chimpanzee named jubilee also that was born in london and all of the zoo's chimps had been born in africa
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she went to kenya and met dr louis leakey there
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1958 leakey sent goodall to london to study primate behavior with two experts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: leakey raised funds and in 1960 goodall went to gombe stream national park becoming the first of leakey's angels
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she was accompanied by her mother whose presence was necessary to satisfy the requirements of david anstey chief warden
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was concerned for their safety tanzania was tanganyika at that time and a british protectorate
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: leakey arranged funding and in 1962 sent goodall who had no degree to cambridge university where she obtained a phd degree in ethology
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she became only the eighth person to be allowed to study for a phd without first obtaining a ba or bsc
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: her thesis was completed in 1965 titled behavior of the free ranging chimpanzee
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it told of her first five years of study at the gombe reserve
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: goodall has been married twice
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on 28 march 1964 she married a dutch nobleman wildlife photographer baron hugo van lawick
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the couple had a son hugo eric louis affectionately known as grub who was born in 1967
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they divorced in 1974
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1975 she married derek bryceson
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was a member of tanzania's parliament and director of national parks he died of cancer in october 1980
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: with his position in the tanzanian government as head of the country's national park system bryceson was able to protect goodall's research project
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he put an embargo on tourism at gombe while he was alive
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in addition to the dbe jane received many honours from other countries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: goodall is best known for her study of chimpanzee social and family life
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she began studying the kasakela chimpanzee community in gombe stream national park tanzania in 1960
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: instead of numbering the chimpanzees she observed she gave them names such as fifi and david greybeard and observed them to have unique and individual personalities an unconventional idea at the time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she found that it isn't only human beings who have personality who are capable of rational though emotions like joy and sorrow
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she also observed behaviors such as hugs kisses pats on the back and even tickling what we consider human actions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: goodall insists that these gestures are evidence of the close supportive affectionate bonds that develop between family members and other individuals within a community which can persist throughout a life span of more than 50 years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these findings suggest similarities between humans and chimpanzees can be seen in emotion intelligence and family and social relationships
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: goodall's research at gombe stream challenged two long standing beliefs of the day that only humans could build and use tools and that chimpanzees were vegetarians
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: while observing one chimpanzee feeding at a termite mound she watched him repeatedly place stalks of grass into termite holes then remove them from the hole covered with clinging termites effectively fishing for termites
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the chimps would also take twigs from trees and strip off the leaves to make the twig more effective a form of object modification which is the rudimentary beginnings of toolmaking
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: man the toolmaker is a famous phrase in anthropology
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in response to jane's research louis leakey wrote we must now redefine man redefine tool or accept chimpanzees as human over the course of her study goodall found evidence of mental traits in chimpanzees such as reasoned thought abstraction generalization symbolic representation and even the concept of self
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all these were thought to be uniquely human abilities
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in contrast to the peaceful and affectionate behaviours she observed goodall also found a mean side of chimpanzee nature at gombe stream
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she realized that chimps will hunt and eat smaller animals such as colobus monkeys
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she discovered that chimps will systematically hunt and eat smaller primates such as colobus monkeys
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: goodall watched a hunting group isolate a colobus high in a tree block all possible exits then one chimpanzee climbed up and captured and killed the colobus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the others then each took parts of the carcass sharing with other members of the troop in response to begging behaviours
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the chimps at gombe kill and eat as much as one third of the colobus population in the park each year
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this alone was a major scientific find which challenged previous conceptions of chimp diet and behavior
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: :"goodall's gombe data have also led researchers to take a closer look at the role that hunting plays in chimp feeding habits
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one recent gombe study for instance concluded that the 45 members of one troop ate a ton of monkey meat per year
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during one hunting binge chimps killed 71 colobus monkeys in 68 days one chimp alone killed 42 monkeys over five years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all told chimps may kill and eat a third of the gombe's colobus population each year
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: researchers have also found that lower ranking males often trade the meat for mating privileges such trades may help prevent inbreeding by keeping a single group of males from fathering the majority of a troop's children
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: also startling and disturbing was the tendency for aggression and violence within chimpanzee troops
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: goodall observed dominant females deliberately killing the young of other females in the troop in order to maintain their dominance sometimes going as far as cannibalism.chimps can do all sorts of things we thought that only we could do like build and make tools and all sorts of other stuff
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: goodall saw highly intelligent emotional creatures living in complex social groups when other researchers saw non communicating apes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she says of this revelation during the first ten years of the study i had believed [...] that the gombe stream chimpanzee s were for the most part rather nicer than human beings then suddenly we found that chimpanzees could be brutal that they like us had a darker side to their nature
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these findings revolutionized our knowledge of chimpanzee behaviour
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they were further evidence of the social similarities between humans and chimpanzees albeit in a much darker manner
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hadrian's wall latin vallum hadriani is a stone and turf fortification built by the roman empire in northern england to stop attacks by scottish tribes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there were three legions working on it and in 10 years it was nearly finished
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was made a unesco world heritage site in 1987
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: english heritage a government in charge of managing the historic environment of england describes it as one of the towering achievements of military engineering and a monument to the power of one of the greatest empires in world history
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the vallum is a huge earthwork associated with hadrian's wall
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: unique on any roman frontier it runs from coast to coast to the south of the wall
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: begun in ad 122 during the rule of the emperor hadrian it was the first of two fortifications built across great britain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the second was the antonine wall the lesser known of the two
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the wall was the most heavily fortified border in the empire
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in addition to its role as a military fortification it is thought that many of the gates through the wall would have served as customs posts to allow trade and levy taxation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a significant portion of the wall still exists particularly the mid section and for much of its length the wall can be followed on foot by hadrian's wall path or by cycle on national cycle route 72
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: stretching for 73 miles across northern england hadrian's wall is the most important monument of roman britain and the best known frontier of the entire roman empire
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: redhead is a person with red or reddishtinted hair
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: approximately 1 to 2% of the world's population has red hair
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: red hair is made by genes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the gene for red hair is recessive meaning to be weaker than other genes like the brown hair gene for example
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because of this in order to have natural red hair a person needs to have redhaired ancestors present on both the maternal mother's and paternal father's side of the family
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: red hair is said to be most common close to the northern european coasts and islands of the atlantic ocean like british isles and in particular among celtic people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in ireland the percentage of population with red hair is very high relative to the rest of the world at around 10% with 46% carrying the gene
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: parts of the united kingdom such as scotland also have very high percentages with around 6%
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there was a misconception that red hair occurrence in scotland ran at around 13% due to this figure appearing in reliable media sources however this figure was only an estimate and has since been disproved by research
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: dr jim wilson of britain's dna has carried out the only large scale genetic study of red hair using a sample of over 2343 people and has found red hair occurrence of 6% in scotland this is concurrent with the largest ever study of hair colour in scotland which analysed over half a million people and found red hair prevalence of 5.3%
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a 1956 study of hair color among british army recruits also found high levels of red hair in wales and the english border counties
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: depite all this the us has the largest number of redheads living there in the world up to 18 million compared to 650000 redheads living in scotland
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in some countries particularly the british isles despite the high proportion of redheads there redheads are sometimes given rude names such as carrot top and ginga and are in some cases heavily ridiculed made fun of by their peers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in some extreme cases people have been harassed others have behaved threateningly towards them for having red hair
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the word he is used for a man or boy where the word she would be used for a woman
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the past he and him were often used as gender neutral pronouns
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in other words the word may have been used in a general way to refer to any person male or female

lines.value: vitamin d is not actually a vitamin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is a steroid hormone which is made in the body under the right conditions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however if the body does not make enough it can also be obtained from food sources
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as a hormone vitamin d does many things in the body
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was first discovered as the substance which could prevent and cure rickets
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it controls the levels of calcium ions and phosphates in the blood as well as calcium and magnesium absorption in the intestines
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it helps bones grow and form
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is also good for the immune system
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in total there are 5 different forms d 1 to d 5
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the most common ones are d 2 and d 3 see images
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: d 3 also called cholecalciferol is the kind produced by the body
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is also found naturally in marine oils and in lanolin oil from sheep's wool the most common source for supplements
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: d 2 also called ergocalciferol is produced by fungi
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is similar to d 3 but not exactly the same
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: d 3 is made in the skin from cholesterol and changed into a more active form by the liver
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however the skin will not make it unless enough ultraviolet light shines on it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as sunlight contains ultraviolet light getting enough sun is one way of getting enough d 3 .many things can keep the skin from making enough d 3
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: winter sunlight may be too weak
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: melanin which protects skin from damage also keeps it from making d 3 which is why people with darker skin are more prone to deficiency
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: older people are also prone because aging skin makes less d 3 even with enough sunlight
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: clothing glass sunscreens and sunblocks also shield the skin from getting enough ultraviolet light to make d 3 .it is hard to know how much supplemental vitamin d if any is needed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some current recommendations from health organizations such as the institute of medicine have recently increased
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are still typically less than 25 micrograms 1000 iu per day but up to 100 mcg 4000 iu per day is considered safe
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a recent panel of vitamin d researchers concluded that at least 20-25 mcg 800-1000 iu per day would be beneficial for most adults
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: very few foods naturally contain much d 3
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: fish do especially oily ones such as salmon sardine and mackerel
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many kinds of edible mushrooms contain some d 2 like shiitake
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mushrooms grown in full sunlight tend to have more
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: d 3 supplements can be easily found for sale in most developed countries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: vitamin d is a fat soluble nutrient
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this means that any portion not used immediately is stored in fat tissue for future use
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some people may get all the vitamin d they need from their diet and the sun
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however if you are pregnant breastfeeding or elderly it would be safest to take at least 15-20 micrograms 600-800 iu of vitamin d each day
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the treatment of vitamin d deficiency is to take vitamin d supplements and increase the amount of time spent in the sun without getting sunburnt
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the zebra mussel is a small shellfish
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: color patterns could vary having only dark or colored shells or no stripes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are typically found attached to objects surfaces or each other by threads underneath the shells
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: although similar in appearance to the quagga mussel the two species can be easily distinguished
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when placed on a surface zebra mussels are stable on their flattened underside while quagga mussels lacking a flat underside will fall over
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are currently a major problem in northern america's great lakes region because of a fast reproduction time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: zebra mussels are notorious for their biofouling capabilities by colonizing water supply pipes of hydroelectric and nuclear power plants public water supply plants and industrial facilities
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as a result they clog water sources
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they colonize pipes constricting flow therefore reducing the intake in heat exchangers condensers fire fighting equipment and air conditioning and cooling systems
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is estimated that zebra mussels will continue to populate the great lakes and even enter the mississippi river region
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they have no relation to zebras.ya
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the dew point is the temperature where water vapour condenses into liquid water

lines.value: all air holds different amounts of water vapour
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the dew point shows the amount of moisture in the air
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the higher the dew point is the higher the level of moisture in the air at a given temperature
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the dew point of humid air will be higher than the dew point of dry air
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: condensation of water vapour starts when the temperature of air is lowered to its dew point and beyond
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the dew point like other measures of humidity can be found from measurement taken by a hygrometer

lines.value: there once were as many as 20000 comanches

lines.value: today the comanche nation has 10000 members most in oklahoma centered at lawton and the rest in texas california and new mexico

lines.value: the comanche speak a language of their own the comanche language that is related to other native american ones called uto aztecan language family
